 148    @classmethod
 149    def from_tdf(
 150        cls,
 151        filename: str,
 152        ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 153        left_hand_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 154        right_hand_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 155        left_foot_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 156        right_foot_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 157        left_heel: str | None = None,
 158        right_heel: str | None = None,
 159        left_toe: str | None = None,
 160        right_toe: str | None = None,
 161        left_metatarsal_head: str | None = None,
 162        right_metatarsal_head: str | None = None,
 163        left_ankle_medial: str | None = None,
 164        left_ankle_lateral: str | None = None,
 165        right_ankle_medial: str | None = None,
 166        right_ankle_lateral: str | None = None,
 167        left_knee_medial: str | None = None,
 168        left_knee_lateral: str | None = None,
 169        right_knee_medial: str | None = None,
 170        right_knee_lateral: str | None = None,
 171        right_throcanter: str | None = None,
 172        left_throcanter: str | None = None,
 173        left_asis: str | None = None,
 174        right_asis: str | None = None,
 175        left_psis: str | None = None,
 176        right_psis: str | None = None,
 177        left_shoulder_anterior: str | None = None,
 178        left_shoulder_posterior: str | None = None,
 179        right_shoulder_anterior: str | None = None,
 180        right_shoulder_posterior: str | None = None,
 181        left_elbow_medial: str | None = None,
 182        left_elbow_lateral: str | None = None,
 183        right_elbow_medial: str | None = None,
 184        right_elbow_lateral: str | None = None,
 185        left_wrist_medial: str | None = None,
 186        left_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
 187        right_wrist_medial: str | None = None,
 188        right_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
 189        s2: str | None = None,
 190        l2: str | None = None,
 191        c7: str | None = None,
 192        sc: str | None = None,
 193    ):
 194
 195        # generate the new object
 196        obj = cls()
 197
 198        # read the file
 199        tdf = TimeseriesRecord.from_tdf(filename)
 200
 201        # check the inputs
 202        inputs = {
 203            "ground_reaction_force": ground_reaction_force,
 204            "left_hand_ground_reaction_force": left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 205            "right_hand_ground_reaction_force": right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 206            "left_foot_ground_reaction_force": left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 207            "right_foot_ground_reaction_force": right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 208            "left_heel": left_heel,
 209            "right_heel": right_heel,
 210            "left_toe": left_toe,
 211            "right_toe": right_toe,
 212            "left_metatarsal_head": left_metatarsal_head,
 213            "right_metatarsal_head": right_metatarsal_head,
 214            "left_ankle_medial": left_ankle_medial,
 215            "left_ankle_lateral": left_ankle_lateral,
 216            "right_ankle_medial": right_ankle_medial,
 217            "right_ankle_lateral": right_ankle_lateral,
 218            "left_knee_medial": left_knee_medial,
 219            "left_knee_lateral": left_knee_lateral,
 220            "right_knee_medial": right_knee_medial,
 221            "right_knee_lateral": right_knee_lateral,
 222            "right_throcanter": right_throcanter,
 223            "left_throcanter": left_throcanter,
 224            "left_asis": left_asis,
 225            "right_asis": right_asis,
 226            "left_psis": left_psis,
 227            "right_psis": right_psis,
 228            "left_shoulder_anterior": left_shoulder_anterior,
 229            "left_shoulder_posterior": left_shoulder_posterior,
 230            "right_shoulder_anterior": right_shoulder_anterior,
 231            "right_shoulder_posterior": right_shoulder_posterior,
 232            "left_elbow_medial": left_elbow_medial,
 233            "left_elbow_lateral": left_elbow_lateral,
 234            "right_elbow_medial": right_elbow_medial,
 235            "right_elbow_lateral": right_elbow_lateral,
 236            "left_wrist_medial": left_wrist_medial,
 237            "left_wrist_lateral": left_wrist_lateral,
 238            "right_wrist_medial": right_wrist_medial,
 239            "right_wrist_lateral": right_wrist_lateral,
 240            "s2": s2,
 241            "c7": c7,
 242            "l2": l2,
 243            "sc": sc,
 244        }
 245        inputs = {i: v for i, v in inputs.items() if v is not None}
 246        keys = tdf.keys()
 247        for lbl, inp in inputs.items():
 248            if inp not in keys:
 249                raise ValueError(f"{inp} not found.")
 250            val = tdf[inp]
 251            if inp in [
 252                left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 253                right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 254                ground_reaction_force,
 255                left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 256                right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 257            ]:
 258                if not isinstance(val, ForcePlatform):
 259                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a ForcePlatform instance."
 260                    raise ValueError(msg)
 261            else:
 262                if not isinstance(val, Point3D):
 263                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a Point3D instance."
 264                    raise ValueError(msg)
 265            obj[lbl] = val
 266        for key, val in tdf.items():
 267            if key not in list(inputs.values()):
 268                obj[key] = val
 269
 270        return obj

 272    def to_dataframe(self):
 273        out = [super().to_dataframe()]
 274        for prop in self._angular_measures:
 275            try:
 276                df = getattr(self, prop).to_dataframe()
 277                df.columns = pd.Index([prop + "_" + i] for i in df.columns)
 278                out += [df]
 279            except Exception as exc:
 280                continue
 281
 282        return pd.concat(out, axis=1)

 284    def _get_point(self, label: str):
 285        element = self.get(label)
 286        if element is None:
 287            raise ValueError(f"{label} not found.")
 288        if not isinstance(element, Point3D):
 289            raise ValueError(f"{label} is not a Point3D.")
 290        return element

 292    def _get_least_squares_plane_coefs(self, *points: Point3D):
 293        """
 294        Calcola i coefficienti del piano (a, b, c, d) per ogni istante temporale
 295        dati almeno 3 punti 3D per ciascun campione.
 296        """
 297        for point in points:
 298            if not isinstance(point, Point3D):
 299                raise ValueError("all points must be Point3D instances.")
 300
 301        # Calcola il baricentro per ogni campione
 302        mat = np.stack([i.to_numpy() for i in points], axis=1)
 303        centroid = np.mean(mat, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 304
 305        # Centra i punti rispetto al baricentro
 306        centered = mat - centroid
 307
 308        # Calcola la matrice di covarianza per ogni campione
 309        cov = np.einsum("nij,nik->njk", centered, centered) / mat.shape[1]
 310
 311        # Calcola autovalori e autovettori
 312        eigvals, eigvecs = np.linalg.eigh(cov)
 313
 314        # L'autovettore associato al minimo autovalore  la normale al piano
 315        normals = eigvecs[:, :, 0]
 316
 317        # Coefficienti a, b, c
 318        a, b, c = normals[:, :3].T
 319
 320        # Calcola d = - (a*x + b*y + c*z) usando il baricentro
 321        d = -np.sum(normals * centroid[:, 0, :], axis=1)
 322
 323        # Stack dei coefficienti
 324        coefficients = np.stack([a, b, c, d], axis=1)
 325
 326        return coefficients
 327
 328    def _get_plane_coefs(
 329        self,
 330        onplane_a: Point3D,
 331        onplane_b: Point3D,
 332        ortogonal_to: Point3D,
 333    ):
 334        """
 335        Calcola i coefficienti (a, b, c, d) del piano passante per onplane_a e
 336        onplane_b, tale che la retta che congiunge ortogonal_to al piano sia
 337        perpendicolare al piano stesso.
 338        """
 339        # Estrai i dati: shape (T, 3)
 340        a_data = onplane_a.to_numpy()
 341        b_data = onplane_b.to_numpy()
 342        o_data = ortogonal_to.to_numpy()
 343
 344        # Vettore nel piano: v = b - a
 345        v = b_data - a_data
 346
 347        # Vettore dalla terza al piano: n_raw = a - ortogonal_to
 348        n_raw = a_data - o_data
 349
 350        # Normalizzazione di v
 351        v_norm = np.linalg.norm(v, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 352        v_unit = v / v_norm
 353
 354        # Proiezione di n_raw su v
 355        proj = np.sum(n_raw * v_unit, axis=1, keepdims=True) * v_unit
 356
 357        # Componente ortogonale a v: normale al piano
 358        normal = n_raw - proj
 359
 360        # Coefficienti a, b, c
 361        a, b, c = normal[:, 0], normal[:, 1], normal[:, 2]
 362
 363        # Calcolo di d usando il punto a_data
 364        d = -np.sum(normal * a_data, axis=1)
 365
 366        # Stack dei coefficienti
 367        coefficients = np.stack([a, b, c, d], axis=1)
 368
 369        return coefficients
 370
 371    def _get_point_to_plane_distance(
 372        self,
 373        point: Point3D,
 374        planes: Timeseries,
 375    ):
 376        """
 377        Calcola la (minima) distanza di un punto da un piano.
 378        """
 379        coefs = planes.to_numpy()
 380        nums = np.sum(point.to_numpy() * coefs[:, :3], axis=1) + coefs[:, 3]
 381        dens = np.sum(coefs[:, :3] ** 2, axis=1) ** 0.5
 382        distances = np.abs(nums) / dens
 383        return Signal1D(data=distances, index=point.index, unit=point.unit)
 384
 385    def _get_translated_point_along_plane(
 386        self,
 387        point: Point3D,
 388        local_translations: Signal3D,
 389        plane: Timeseries,
 390    ):
 391        """
 392        Trasla punti 3D lungo gli assi locali definiti da un piano.
 393        """
 394        # Estrai i coefficienti a, b, c
 395        normals = plane.ix[:, :3].to_numpy()
 396        norm_normals = np.linalg.norm(normals, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 397        normals_unit = normals / norm_normals  # normalizzazione
 398
 399        # Vettore arbitrario per costruire base ortonormale
 400        arbitrary = np.tile(np.array([1.0, 0.0, 0.0]), (len(normals_unit), 1))
 401        parallel_mask = np.isclose(
 402            np.abs(np.sum(normals_unit * arbitrary, axis=1)), 1.0
 403        )
 404        arbitrary[parallel_mask] = np.array([0.0, 1.0, 0.0])
 405
 406        # Asse x locale
 407        x_local = np.cross(arbitrary, normals_unit)
 408        x_local /= np.linalg.norm(x_local, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 409
 410        # Asse y locale
 411        y_local = np.cross(normals_unit, x_local)
 412        y_local /= np.linalg.norm(y_local, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 413
 414        # Matrice di rotazione: colonne = [x_local, y_local, normale]
 415        R = np.stack([x_local, y_local, normals_unit], axis=2)  # shape (N, 3, 3)
 416
 417        # Trasformazione delle traslazioni locali in globali
 418        l_trans = np.asarray(local_translations)
 419        T_global = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, l_trans)
 420
 421        # Applica la traslazione ai punti
 422        out: Point3D = point.copy() + T_global
 423        return out
 424
 425    def _get_intersection_between_line_to_plane(
 426        self,
 427        p1: Point3D,
 428        p2: Point3D,
 429        plane: Timeseries,
 430    ):
 431        """
 432        Calcola il punto di intersezione tra una linea (p1 -> p2) e un
 433        piano definito da (a, b, c, d) per ogni istante temporale.
 434        """
 435        direction = np.asarray(p2 - p1)
 436        planearr = np.asarray(plane)
 437        a, b, c, d = planearr.T
 438        normal = np.stack([a, b, c], axis=1)
 439
 440        numerator = -(np.sum(normal * p1, axis=1) + d)
 441        denominator = np.sum(normal * direction, axis=1)
 442
 443        with np.errstate(divide="ignore", invalid="ignore"):
 444            t = np.where(denominator != 0, numerator / denominator, np.nan)
 445
 446        intersection_points = p1 + direction * t[:, np.newaxis]
 447        return intersection_points._data
 448
 449    def _get_projection_point_on_plane(
 450        self,
 451        point: Point3D,
 452        plane: Timeseries,
 453    ):
 454        """
 455        Calcola il punto sul piano (per ogni istante temporale) che minimizza
 456        la distanza da un punto 3D: la proiezione ortogonale.
 457        """
 458        point_array = point.to_numpy()  # [x, y, z]
 459        planearr = plane.to_numpy()  # Nx4: [a, b, c, d]
 460        a, b, c, d = planearr.T
 461        normal = np.stack([a, b, c], axis=1)
 462
 463        numerator = np.sum(normal * point_array, axis=1) + d
 464        denominator = np.sum(normal**2, axis=1)
 465
 466        with np.errstate(divide="ignore", invalid="ignore"):
 467            t = np.where(denominator != 0, numerator / denominator, np.nan)
 468
 469        projection_points = point_array - normal * t[:, np.newaxis]
 470
 471        return Point3D(
 472            data=projection_points,
 473            index=point.index,
 474            columns=point.columns,
 475            unit=point.unit,
 476        )
 477
 478    def _get_angle_between_three_points(
 479        self,
 480        p1: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 481        p2: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 482        p3: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 483    ):
 484        """
 485        Calcola l'angolo (in gradi) formato da tre punti 3D: A, B, C
 486        dove B  il vertice.
 487        """
 488
 489        # get the segments length
 490        v1 = p1.to_numpy() if isinstance(p1, Point3D) else p1
 491        v2 = p2.to_numpy() if isinstance(p2, Point3D) else p2
 492        v3 = p3.to_numpy() if isinstance(p3, Point3D) else p3
 493        AB = ((v1 - v2) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 494        BC = ((v2 - v3) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 495        AC = ((v1 - v3) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 496
 497        cos_angle = np.clip((AC**2 - AB**2 - BC**2) / (-2 * AB * BC), -1, 1)
 498        angle_rad = np.arccos(cos_angle)
 499        angle_deg = np.degrees(angle_rad)
 500
 501        return np.asarray(angle_deg, float)
 502
 503    def _get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 504        self,
 505        point: Point3D,
 506        origin: Point3D,
 507        direction: Point3D,
 508    ):
 509        """
 510        Get the projection of multiple points onto their respective axes defined
 511        by origin and direction vectors in 3D space.
 512        """
 513        # Convert to numpy arrays
 514        point_np = point.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 515        origin_np = origin.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 516        direction_np = direction.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 517
 518        # Vettori dal punto all'origine
 519        v = point_np - origin_np  # shape (n, 3)
 520
 521        # Lunghezza della proiezione scalare su ciascun asse
 522        proj_length = np.sum(v * direction_np, axis=1)
 523        proj_length /= np.sum(direction_np**2, axis=1)  # shape (n,)
 524
 525        # Calcolo dei punti proiettati
 526        proj_np = origin_np + (
 527            proj_length[:, np.newaxis] * direction_np
 528        )  # shape (n, 3)
 529
 530        # Restituisce un nuovo Point3D con le stesse propriet del punto originale
 531        return Point3D(
 532            proj_np,
 533            point.index,
 534            point.unit,
 535            point.columns,
 536        )
 537
 538    def _get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
 539        self,
 540        point: Point3D,
 541        origin: Point3D,
 542        rotation_matrix: np.ndarray,
 543        axis_a: str | Literal["X", "Y", "Z"],
 544        axis_b: str | Literal["X", "Y", "Z"],
 545    ):
 546
 547        # get the relevant axis map
 548        cols = point.columns
 549        plane_axes = np.array([axis_a, axis_b])
 550        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in plane_axes]
 551        col_map = np.array(col_map)
 552
 553        # get the point used to calculate the angle
 554        centered = (point - origin).to_numpy()
 555        rotated = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rotation_matrix, centered)
 556        x, y = rotated[:, col_map].T
 557
 558        # get the angle
 559        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
 560
 561        # convert to signal
 562        angle = Signal1D(angle, point.index, "")
 563
 564        return angle, np.asarray(x, float), np.asarray(y, float)
 565
 566    def _get_projected_pelvis_points(self):
 567        # get the pelvis references
 568        l_asis = self._get_point("left_asis")
 569        r_asis = self._get_point("right_asis")
 570        l_psis = self._get_point("left_psis")
 571        r_psis = self._get_point("right_psis")
 572
 573        # generate the pelvis plane by least squares
 574        plane = self._get_least_squares_plane_coefs(l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis)
 575        plane = Timeseries(
 576            data=plane,
 577            index=l_asis.index,
 578            columns=["a", "b", "c", "d"],
 579            unit="a.u.",
 580        )
 581
 582        # get the projected points
 583        l_asis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(l_asis, plane)
 584        r_asis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(r_asis, plane)
 585        l_psis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(l_psis, plane)
 586        r_psis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(r_psis, plane)
 587
 588        return l_asis_proj, r_asis_proj, l_psis_proj, r_psis_proj
 589
 590    @property
 591    def left_ankle_referenceframe(self):
 592        """
 593        return the left ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 594
 595        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 596            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 597
 598        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 599        the reference frame.
 600        """
 601        ankle_lat: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
 602        ankle_med: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
 603        ankle = self.left_ankle
 604        knee = self.left_knee
 605
 606        # get the rotation matrix
 607        new_x = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
 608        new_y = (knee - ankle).to_numpy()
 609        rmat = gram_schmidt(new_x, new_y).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 610        rmat = np.asarray(rmat, float)
 611
 612        return ankle, rmat
 613
 614    @property
 615    def right_ankle_referenceframe(self):
 616        """
 617        return the right ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 618
 619        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 620            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 621
 622        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 623        the reference frame.
 624        """
 625        ankle_lat: Point3D = self._get_point("right_ankle_lateral")
 626        ankle_med: Point3D = self._get_point("right_ankle_medial")
 627        ankle = self.right_ankle
 628        knee = self.right_knee
 629
 630        # get the rotation matrix
 631        new_x = (ankle_med - ankle_lat).to_numpy()
 632        new_y = (knee - ankle).to_numpy()
 633        rmat = gram_schmidt(new_x, new_y).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 634        rmat = np.asarray(rmat, float)
 635
 636        return ankle, rmat

 648        """

 651    @property
 652    def right_hip_referenceframe(self):
 653        """
 654        return the right hip reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 655
 656        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 657            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 658

 660        the reference frame.

 663
 664    @property
 665    def pelvis_referenceframe(self):
 666        """
 667        return the pelvis reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 668
 669        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 670            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 671
 672        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 673        the reference frame.
 674        """
 675
 676        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
 677        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 678
 679        # get the plane versors
 680        centroid = (l_asis + r_asis + l_psis + r_psis) / 4
 681        i = np.asarray((l_asis + l_psis) / 2 - centroid, float)
 682        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 683        k = np.asarray((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - centroid, float)
 684        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 685        j = np.cross(k, i)
 686
 687        # obtain the rotation matrix
 688        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 689
 690        return centroid, rmat
 691
 692    @property
 693    def left_shoulder_referenceframe(self):
 694        """
 695        Return the left shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 696
 697        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 698            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 699
 700        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 701        the reference frame.
 702        """
 703        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 704        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
 705        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
 706        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
 707        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
 708
 709        # determino l'asse verticale
 710        j = c7 - base
 711
 712        # calcolo le coordinate della proiezione della spalla sull'asse
 713        # verticale passante per il centro della pelvi
 714        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 715            point=shoulder,
 716            origin=pelvis_center,
 717            direction=j,
 718        )
 719
 720        # calcolo l'asse laterale
 721        i = shoulder - proj
 722
 723        # ottengo la matrice di rotazione
 724        rmat = gram_schmidt(i.to_numpy(), j.to_numpy()).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 725
 726        return shoulder, rmat
 727
 728    @property
 729    def right_shoulder_referenceframe(self):
 730        """
 731        Return the right shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 732
 733        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 734            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 735
 736        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 737        the reference frame.
 738        """
 739        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 740        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
 741        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
 742        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
 743        shoulder = self.right_shoulder
 744
 745        # determino l'asse verticale
 746        j = c7 - base
 747
 748        # calcolo le coordinate della proiezione della spalla sull'asse
 749        # verticale passante per il centro della pelvi
 750        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 751            point=shoulder,
 752            origin=pelvis_center,
 753            direction=j,
 754        )
 755
 756        # calcolo l'asse laterale
 757        i = proj - shoulder
 758
 759        # ottengo la matrice di rotazione
 760        rmat = gram_schmidt(i.to_numpy(), j.to_numpy()).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 761
 762        return shoulder, rmat

 764    @property
 765    def left_ankle(self):
 766        lat: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
 767        med: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
 768        return Point3D(
 769            data=(lat._data + med._data) / 2,
 770            index=np.unique(np.concatenate([lat.index, med.index])),
 771            columns=lat.columns,
 772        )

 804    @property
 805    def pelvis_center(self):
 806        return self.pelvis_referenceframe[0]
 807
 808    @property
 809    def pelvis_plane(self):
 810
 811        # extract the normal as the vertical axis denoted by the rotation
 812        # matrix of the pelvis reference frame
 813        centroid, rmat = self.pelvis_referenceframe
 814        normal = rmat[:, 1, :]
 815
 816        # get the "d" coefficient
 817        d = np.atleast_2d(-np.sum(normal * centroid.to_numpy(), axis=1)).T
 818
 819        # return the timeseries
 820        return Timeseries(
 821            data=np.hstack([normal, d]),
 822            index=centroid.index,
 823            columns=["a", "b", "c", "d"],
 824            unit="a.u.",
 825        )
 826
 827    @property
 828    def pelvis_width(self):
 829        l_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("left_asis")
 830        r_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("right_asis")
 831        index = [l_asis.index, r_asis.index]
 832        index = np.unique(np.concatenate(index)).tolist()
 833        data = np.asarray(l_asis - r_asis)
 834        data = np.sum(data**2, axis=1) ** 0.5
 835        return Signal1D(data=data, index=index, unit=l_asis.unit)
 836
 837    @property
 838    def pelvis_height(self):
 839        pelvis_plane = self.pelvis_plane
 840        l_troc = self._get_point("left_throcanter")
 841        r_troc = self._get_point("right_throcanter")
 842        l_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(l_troc, pelvis_plane)
 843        r_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(r_troc, pelvis_plane)
 844        return Signal1D(
 845            data=(l_dist + r_dist).to_numpy() / 2,
 846            index=pelvis_plane.index,
 847            unit=l_dist.unit,
 848        )
 849
 850    @property
 851    def left_hip(self):
 852
 853        # get the De Leva (1996) approximations
 854        p0 = self.pelvis_center
 855        width = self.pelvis_width.to_numpy()
 856        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
 857        offset_ml = -0.19 * width
 858        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
 859        offset_ap = 0.36 * width
 860        offsets = Signal3D(
 861            data=np.hstack([offset_ml, offset_vt, offset_ap]),
 862            index=p0.index,
 863            columns=p0.columns,
 864            unit=p0.unit,
 865        )
 866        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
 867            self._get_point("left_throcanter"),
 868            offsets,
 869            self.pelvis_plane,
 870        )
 871
 872    @property
 873    def right_hip(self):
 874
 875        # get the De Leva (1996) approximations
 876        p0 = self.pelvis_center
 877        width = self.pelvis_width.to_numpy()
 878        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
 879        offset_ml = +0.19 * width
 880        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
 881        offset_ap = +0.36 * width
 882        offsets = Signal3D(
 883            data=np.hstack([offset_ml, offset_vt, offset_ap]),
 884            index=p0.index,
 885            columns=p0.columns,
 886            unit=p0.unit,
 887        )
 888        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
 889            self._get_point("right_throcanter"),
 890            offsets,
 891            self.pelvis_plane,
 892        )

 978    @property
 979    def left_ankle_flexionextension(self):
 980        """
 981        the the dorsal (positive) or plantar (negative) flexion of the
 982        left ankle with respect to he shin in degrees
 983        """
 984        # get points and reference frame
 985        ankle, rmat = self.left_ankle_referenceframe
 986        proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(
 987            ankle,
 988            self.left_foot_plane,
 989        )
 990        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
 991            proj,
 992            ankle,
 993            rmat,
 994            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
 995            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
 996        )
 997
 998        # adjust the signs
 999        return angle + 90
1000

1010            self.right_foot_plane,

1012        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(

1015            rmat,
1016            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
1017            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
1018        )

1020        return angle + 90

1046        the inversion (negative) or eversion (positive) angle of the

1048        """

1064    @property
1065    def left_knee_flexionextension(self):
1066        """
1067        return the left knee flexion in degrees.
1068        Extension will be negative
1069        """
1070        p1 = self.left_hip
1071        p2 = self.left_knee
1072        p3 = self.left_ankle
1073        angle = 180 - self._get_angle_between_three_points(p1, p2, p3)
1074        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=p1.index, unit="")

1122    @property
1123    def left_hip_abductionadduction(self):
1124        """
1125        Return the left hip abduction/adduction in degrees.
1126        Abduction will be positive, adduction negative.
1127        """
1128        # get points and reference frame
1129        hip, rmat = self.left_hip_referenceframe
1130        knee = self.left_knee
1131        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
1132            knee,
1133            hip,
1134            rmat,
1135            self.lateral_axis,  # type: ignore
1136            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
1137        )
1138
1139        return angle + 90
1140
1141    @property
1142    def right_hip_abductionadduction(self):
1143        """
1144        Return the right hip abduction/adduction in degrees.
1145        Abduction will be positive, adduction negative.
1146        """
1147        hip, rmat = self.right_hip_referenceframe
1148        knee = self.right_knee
1149        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
1150            knee,
1151            hip,
1152            rmat,
1153            self.lateral_axis,  # type: ignore
1154            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
1155        )
1156
1157        # adjust the sign according to the knee position
1158        return -1 * (90 + angle)
1159
1160    @property
1161    def left_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1162        """
1163        Return the left hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1164        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1165        """
1166
1167        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1168        rmat = self.left_hip_referenceframe[1]
1169        knee_lat = self._get_point("left_knee_lateral")
1170        knee_med = self._get_point("left_knee_medial")
1171        ankle_lat = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
1172        ankle_med = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
1173
1174        # ottengo il vettore medio
1175        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1176        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1177        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1178
1179        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1180        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1181        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1182        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1183        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1184        j = np.cross(k, i)
1185        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1186
1187        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1188        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1189
1190        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1191        # generato
1192        cols = knee_lat.columns
1193        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1194        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1195        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1196        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1197
1198        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1199        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1200
1201        # Ritorno l'angolo
1202        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")
1203
1204    @property
1205    def right_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1206        """
1207        Return the right hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1208        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1209        """
1210        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1211        rmat = self.right_hip_referenceframe[1]
1212        knee_lat = self._get_point("right_knee_lateral")
1213        knee_med = self._get_point("right_knee_medial")
1214        ankle_lat = self._get_point("right_ankle_lateral")
1215        ankle_med = self._get_point("right_ankle_medial")
1216
1217        # ottengo il vettore medio
1218        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1219        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1220        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1221
1222        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1223        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1224        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1225        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1226        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1227        j = np.cross(k, i)
1228        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1229
1230        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1231        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1232
1233        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1234        # generato
1235        cols = knee_lat.columns
1236        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1237        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1238        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1239        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1240
1241        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1242        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1243
1244        # correggo il segno dell'angolo
1245        angle = 180 - angle
1246        angle[y < 0] = angle[y < 0] - 360
1247
1248        # Ritorno l'angolo
1249        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")

1251    @property
1252    def pelvis_anteroposteriortilt_global(self):
1253        """
1254        Return the pelvis pitch (sagittal tilt) in degrees with respect to
1255        the global reference frame.
1256        Anterior tilt is negative, posterior tilt is positive.
1257        """
1258
1259        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
1260        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1261
1262        # definisco il vettore che determina l'asse anteroposteriore del bacino
1263        ap = ((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - (l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1264
1265        # considero solo il piano sagittale globale
1266        cols = l_asis.columns
1267        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1268        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1269        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1270
1271        # calcolo l'angolo
1272        x, y = ap[:, col_map].T
1273        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1274
1275        # Ritorno langolo
1276        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=l_asis.index, unit="")
1277

1332    @property
1333    def trunk_flexionextension_global(self):
1334        """
1335        Return the trunk flexion/extension in degrees with respect
1336        to the global reference frame.
1337        Flexion is positive, extension is negative.
1338        """
1339
1340        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
1341        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1342
1343        # ottengo il vettore che definisce il rachide
1344        c7 = self._get_point("c7").to_numpy()
1345        base = ((l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1346        vt = c7 - base
1347
1348        # considero solo il piano sagittale globale
1349        cols = l_psis.columns
1350        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1351        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1352        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1353
1354        # calcolo l'angolo
1355        x, y = vt[:, col_map].T
1356        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1357
1358        # Ritorno langolo
1359        return Signal1D(data=90 - angle, index=l_psis.index, unit="")

1390    @property
1391    def trunk_rotation_global(self):
1392        """
1393        Return the trunk axial rotation in degrees with respect to the
1394        global reference frame.
1395        Right rotation is positive, left rotation is negative.
1396        """
1397
1398        # ottengo il vettore che definisce l'asse delle spalle
1399        vt = self.left_shoulder - self.right_shoulder
1400
1401        # considero solo il piano trasverso globale
1402        cols = vt.columns
1403        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]

1406

1409        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1410
1411        # Ritorno langolo
1412        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=vt.index, unit="")

1550    @property
1551    def left_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1552        """
1553        Return the left shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1554        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1555        """
1556        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1557        elbow_lat = self._get_point("left_elbow_lateral")
1558        elbow_med = self._get_point("left_elbow_medial")
1559        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1560        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
1561        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
1562        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
1563        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
1564        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
1565            shoulder,
1566            pelvis_center,
1567            c7 - base,
1568        )
1569
1570        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1571        va = (elbow_lat - elbow_med).to_numpy()
1572
1573        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1574        i = (shoulder - proj).to_numpy()
1575        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1576        k = (shoulder - self.left_elbow).to_numpy()
1577        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1578        j = np.cross(k, i)
1579        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1580
1581        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1582        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1583
1584        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1585        # generato
1586        cols = elbow_lat.columns
1587        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1588        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1589        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1590        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1591
1592        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1593        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1594
1595        # Ritorno l'angolo
1596        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")
1597
1598    @property
1599    def right_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1600        """
1601        Return the right shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1602        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1603        """
1604        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1605        elbow_lat = self._get_point("right_elbow_lateral")
1606        elbow_med = self._get_point("right_elbow_medial")
1607        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1608        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
1609        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
1610        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
1611        shoulder = self.right_shoulder
1612        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
1613            shoulder,
1614            pelvis_center,
1615            c7 - base,
1616        )
1617
1618        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1619        va = (elbow_med - elbow_lat).to_numpy()
1620
1621        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1622        i = (proj - shoulder).to_numpy()
1623        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1624        k = (shoulder - self.right_elbow).to_numpy()
1625        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1626        j = np.cross(k, i)
1627        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1628
1629        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1630        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1631
1632        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1633        # generato
1634        cols = elbow_lat.columns
1635        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1636        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1637        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1638        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1639
1640        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1641        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1642
1643        # Ritorno l'angolo
1644        return Signal1D(data=-angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")

 149    @classmethod
 150    def from_tdf(
 151        cls,
 152        filename: str,
 153        ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 154        left_hand_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 155        right_hand_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 156        left_foot_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 157        right_foot_ground_reaction_force: str | None = None,
 158        left_heel: str | None = None,
 159        right_heel: str | None = None,
 160        left_toe: str | None = None,
 161        right_toe: str | None = None,
 162        left_metatarsal_head: str | None = None,
 163        right_metatarsal_head: str | None = None,
 164        left_ankle_medial: str | None = None,
 165        left_ankle_lateral: str | None = None,
 166        right_ankle_medial: str | None = None,
 167        right_ankle_lateral: str | None = None,
 168        left_knee_medial: str | None = None,
 169        left_knee_lateral: str | None = None,
 170        right_knee_medial: str | None = None,
 171        right_knee_lateral: str | None = None,
 172        right_throcanter: str | None = None,
 173        left_throcanter: str | None = None,
 174        left_asis: str | None = None,
 175        right_asis: str | None = None,
 176        left_psis: str | None = None,
 177        right_psis: str | None = None,
 178        left_shoulder_anterior: str | None = None,
 179        left_shoulder_posterior: str | None = None,
 180        right_shoulder_anterior: str | None = None,
 181        right_shoulder_posterior: str | None = None,
 182        left_elbow_medial: str | None = None,
 183        left_elbow_lateral: str | None = None,
 184        right_elbow_medial: str | None = None,
 185        right_elbow_lateral: str | None = None,
 186        left_wrist_medial: str | None = None,
 187        left_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
 188        right_wrist_medial: str | None = None,
 189        right_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
 190        s2: str | None = None,
 191        l2: str | None = None,
 192        c7: str | None = None,
 193        sc: str | None = None,
 194    ):
 195
 196        # generate the new object
 197        obj = cls()
 198
 199        # read the file
 200        tdf = TimeseriesRecord.from_tdf(filename)
 201
 202        # check the inputs
 203        inputs = {
 204            "ground_reaction_force": ground_reaction_force,
 205            "left_hand_ground_reaction_force": left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 206            "right_hand_ground_reaction_force": right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 207            "left_foot_ground_reaction_force": left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 208            "right_foot_ground_reaction_force": right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 209            "left_heel": left_heel,
 210            "right_heel": right_heel,
 211            "left_toe": left_toe,
 212            "right_toe": right_toe,
 213            "left_metatarsal_head": left_metatarsal_head,
 214            "right_metatarsal_head": right_metatarsal_head,
 215            "left_ankle_medial": left_ankle_medial,
 216            "left_ankle_lateral": left_ankle_lateral,
 217            "right_ankle_medial": right_ankle_medial,
 218            "right_ankle_lateral": right_ankle_lateral,
 219            "left_knee_medial": left_knee_medial,
 220            "left_knee_lateral": left_knee_lateral,
 221            "right_knee_medial": right_knee_medial,
 222            "right_knee_lateral": right_knee_lateral,
 223            "right_throcanter": right_throcanter,
 224            "left_throcanter": left_throcanter,
 225            "left_asis": left_asis,
 226            "right_asis": right_asis,
 227            "left_psis": left_psis,
 228            "right_psis": right_psis,
 229            "left_shoulder_anterior": left_shoulder_anterior,
 230            "left_shoulder_posterior": left_shoulder_posterior,
 231            "right_shoulder_anterior": right_shoulder_anterior,
 232            "right_shoulder_posterior": right_shoulder_posterior,
 233            "left_elbow_medial": left_elbow_medial,
 234            "left_elbow_lateral": left_elbow_lateral,
 235            "right_elbow_medial": right_elbow_medial,
 236            "right_elbow_lateral": right_elbow_lateral,
 237            "left_wrist_medial": left_wrist_medial,
 238            "left_wrist_lateral": left_wrist_lateral,
 239            "right_wrist_medial": right_wrist_medial,
 240            "right_wrist_lateral": right_wrist_lateral,
 241            "s2": s2,
 242            "c7": c7,
 243            "l2": l2,
 244            "sc": sc,
 245        }
 246        inputs = {i: v for i, v in inputs.items() if v is not None}
 247        keys = tdf.keys()
 248        for lbl, inp in inputs.items():
 249            if inp not in keys:
 250                raise ValueError(f"{inp} not found.")
 251            val = tdf[inp]
 252            if inp in [
 253                left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 254                right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
 255                ground_reaction_force,
 256                left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 257                right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
 258            ]:
 259                if not isinstance(val, ForcePlatform):
 260                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a ForcePlatform instance."
 261                    raise ValueError(msg)
 262            else:
 263                if not isinstance(val, Point3D):
 264                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a Point3D instance."
 265                    raise ValueError(msg)
 266            obj[lbl] = val
 267        for key, val in tdf.items():
 268            if key not in list(inputs.values()):
 269                obj[key] = val
 270
 271        return obj
 272
 273    def to_dataframe(self):
 274        out = [super().to_dataframe()]
 275        for prop in self._angular_measures:
 276            try:
 277                df = getattr(self, prop).to_dataframe()
 278                df.columns = pd.Index([prop + "_" + i] for i in df.columns)
 279                out += [df]
 280            except Exception as exc:
 281                continue
 282
 283        return pd.concat(out, axis=1)
 284
 285    def _get_point(self, label: str):
 286        element = self.get(label)
 287        if element is None:
 288            raise ValueError(f"{label} not found.")
 289        if not isinstance(element, Point3D):
 290            raise ValueError(f"{label} is not a Point3D.")
 291        return element
 292
 293    def _get_least_squares_plane_coefs(self, *points: Point3D):
 294        """
 295        Calcola i coefficienti del piano (a, b, c, d) per ogni istante temporale
 296        dati almeno 3 punti 3D per ciascun campione.
 297        """
 298        for point in points:
 299            if not isinstance(point, Point3D):
 300                raise ValueError("all points must be Point3D instances.")
 301
 302        # Calcola il baricentro per ogni campione
 303        mat = np.stack([i.to_numpy() for i in points], axis=1)
 304        centroid = np.mean(mat, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 305
 306        # Centra i punti rispetto al baricentro
 307        centered = mat - centroid
 308
 309        # Calcola la matrice di covarianza per ogni campione
 310        cov = np.einsum("nij,nik->njk", centered, centered) / mat.shape[1]
 311
 312        # Calcola autovalori e autovettori
 313        eigvals, eigvecs = np.linalg.eigh(cov)
 314
 315        # L'autovettore associato al minimo autovalore  la normale al piano
 316        normals = eigvecs[:, :, 0]
 317
 318        # Coefficienti a, b, c
 319        a, b, c = normals[:, :3].T
 320
 321        # Calcola d = - (a*x + b*y + c*z) usando il baricentro
 322        d = -np.sum(normals * centroid[:, 0, :], axis=1)
 323
 324        # Stack dei coefficienti
 325        coefficients = np.stack([a, b, c, d], axis=1)
 326
 327        return coefficients
 328
 329    def _get_plane_coefs(
 330        self,
 331        onplane_a: Point3D,
 332        onplane_b: Point3D,
 333        ortogonal_to: Point3D,
 334    ):
 335        """
 336        Calcola i coefficienti (a, b, c, d) del piano passante per onplane_a e
 337        onplane_b, tale che la retta che congiunge ortogonal_to al piano sia
 338        perpendicolare al piano stesso.
 339        """
 340        # Estrai i dati: shape (T, 3)
 341        a_data = onplane_a.to_numpy()
 342        b_data = onplane_b.to_numpy()
 343        o_data = ortogonal_to.to_numpy()
 344
 345        # Vettore nel piano: v = b - a
 346        v = b_data - a_data
 347
 348        # Vettore dalla terza al piano: n_raw = a - ortogonal_to
 349        n_raw = a_data - o_data
 350
 351        # Normalizzazione di v
 352        v_norm = np.linalg.norm(v, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 353        v_unit = v / v_norm
 354
 355        # Proiezione di n_raw su v
 356        proj = np.sum(n_raw * v_unit, axis=1, keepdims=True) * v_unit
 357
 358        # Componente ortogonale a v: normale al piano
 359        normal = n_raw - proj
 360
 361        # Coefficienti a, b, c
 362        a, b, c = normal[:, 0], normal[:, 1], normal[:, 2]
 363
 364        # Calcolo di d usando il punto a_data
 365        d = -np.sum(normal * a_data, axis=1)
 366
 367        # Stack dei coefficienti
 368        coefficients = np.stack([a, b, c, d], axis=1)
 369
 370        return coefficients
 371
 372    def _get_point_to_plane_distance(
 373        self,
 374        point: Point3D,
 375        planes: Timeseries,
 376    ):
 377        """
 378        Calcola la (minima) distanza di un punto da un piano.
 379        """
 380        coefs = planes.to_numpy()
 381        nums = np.sum(point.to_numpy() * coefs[:, :3], axis=1) + coefs[:, 3]
 382        dens = np.sum(coefs[:, :3] ** 2, axis=1) ** 0.5
 383        distances = np.abs(nums) / dens
 384        return Signal1D(data=distances, index=point.index, unit=point.unit)
 385
 386    def _get_translated_point_along_plane(
 387        self,
 388        point: Point3D,
 389        local_translations: Signal3D,
 390        plane: Timeseries,
 391    ):
 392        """
 393        Trasla punti 3D lungo gli assi locali definiti da un piano.
 394        """
 395        # Estrai i coefficienti a, b, c
 396        normals = plane.ix[:, :3].to_numpy()
 397        norm_normals = np.linalg.norm(normals, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 398        normals_unit = normals / norm_normals  # normalizzazione
 399
 400        # Vettore arbitrario per costruire base ortonormale
 401        arbitrary = np.tile(np.array([1.0, 0.0, 0.0]), (len(normals_unit), 1))
 402        parallel_mask = np.isclose(
 403            np.abs(np.sum(normals_unit * arbitrary, axis=1)), 1.0
 404        )
 405        arbitrary[parallel_mask] = np.array([0.0, 1.0, 0.0])
 406
 407        # Asse x locale
 408        x_local = np.cross(arbitrary, normals_unit)
 409        x_local /= np.linalg.norm(x_local, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 410
 411        # Asse y locale
 412        y_local = np.cross(normals_unit, x_local)
 413        y_local /= np.linalg.norm(y_local, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 414
 415        # Matrice di rotazione: colonne = [x_local, y_local, normale]
 416        R = np.stack([x_local, y_local, normals_unit], axis=2)  # shape (N, 3, 3)
 417
 418        # Trasformazione delle traslazioni locali in globali
 419        l_trans = np.asarray(local_translations)
 420        T_global = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, l_trans)
 421
 422        # Applica la traslazione ai punti
 423        out: Point3D = point.copy() + T_global
 424        return out
 425
 426    def _get_intersection_between_line_to_plane(
 427        self,
 428        p1: Point3D,
 429        p2: Point3D,
 430        plane: Timeseries,
 431    ):
 432        """
 433        Calcola il punto di intersezione tra una linea (p1 -> p2) e un
 434        piano definito da (a, b, c, d) per ogni istante temporale.
 435        """
 436        direction = np.asarray(p2 - p1)
 437        planearr = np.asarray(plane)
 438        a, b, c, d = planearr.T
 439        normal = np.stack([a, b, c], axis=1)
 440
 441        numerator = -(np.sum(normal * p1, axis=1) + d)
 442        denominator = np.sum(normal * direction, axis=1)
 443
 444        with np.errstate(divide="ignore", invalid="ignore"):
 445            t = np.where(denominator != 0, numerator / denominator, np.nan)
 446
 447        intersection_points = p1 + direction * t[:, np.newaxis]
 448        return intersection_points._data
 449
 450    def _get_projection_point_on_plane(
 451        self,
 452        point: Point3D,
 453        plane: Timeseries,
 454    ):
 455        """
 456        Calcola il punto sul piano (per ogni istante temporale) che minimizza
 457        la distanza da un punto 3D: la proiezione ortogonale.
 458        """
 459        point_array = point.to_numpy()  # [x, y, z]
 460        planearr = plane.to_numpy()  # Nx4: [a, b, c, d]
 461        a, b, c, d = planearr.T
 462        normal = np.stack([a, b, c], axis=1)
 463
 464        numerator = np.sum(normal * point_array, axis=1) + d
 465        denominator = np.sum(normal**2, axis=1)
 466
 467        with np.errstate(divide="ignore", invalid="ignore"):
 468            t = np.where(denominator != 0, numerator / denominator, np.nan)
 469
 470        projection_points = point_array - normal * t[:, np.newaxis]
 471
 472        return Point3D(
 473            data=projection_points,
 474            index=point.index,
 475            columns=point.columns,
 476            unit=point.unit,
 477        )
 478
 479    def _get_angle_between_three_points(
 480        self,
 481        p1: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 482        p2: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 483        p3: Point3D | np.ndarray,
 484    ):
 485        """
 486        Calcola l'angolo (in gradi) formato da tre punti 3D: A, B, C
 487        dove B  il vertice.
 488        """
 489
 490        # get the segments length
 491        v1 = p1.to_numpy() if isinstance(p1, Point3D) else p1
 492        v2 = p2.to_numpy() if isinstance(p2, Point3D) else p2
 493        v3 = p3.to_numpy() if isinstance(p3, Point3D) else p3
 494        AB = ((v1 - v2) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 495        BC = ((v2 - v3) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 496        AC = ((v1 - v3) ** 2).sum(axis=1) ** 0.5
 497
 498        cos_angle = np.clip((AC**2 - AB**2 - BC**2) / (-2 * AB * BC), -1, 1)
 499        angle_rad = np.arccos(cos_angle)
 500        angle_deg = np.degrees(angle_rad)
 501
 502        return np.asarray(angle_deg, float)
 503
 504    def _get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 505        self,
 506        point: Point3D,
 507        origin: Point3D,
 508        direction: Point3D,
 509    ):
 510        """
 511        Get the projection of multiple points onto their respective axes defined
 512        by origin and direction vectors in 3D space.
 513        """
 514        # Convert to numpy arrays
 515        point_np = point.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 516        origin_np = origin.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 517        direction_np = direction.to_numpy()  # shape (n, 3)
 518
 519        # Vettori dal punto all'origine
 520        v = point_np - origin_np  # shape (n, 3)
 521
 522        # Lunghezza della proiezione scalare su ciascun asse
 523        proj_length = np.sum(v * direction_np, axis=1)
 524        proj_length /= np.sum(direction_np**2, axis=1)  # shape (n,)
 525
 526        # Calcolo dei punti proiettati
 527        proj_np = origin_np + (
 528            proj_length[:, np.newaxis] * direction_np
 529        )  # shape (n, 3)
 530
 531        # Restituisce un nuovo Point3D con le stesse propriet del punto originale
 532        return Point3D(
 533            proj_np,
 534            point.index,
 535            point.unit,
 536            point.columns,
 537        )
 538
 539    def _get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
 540        self,
 541        point: Point3D,
 542        origin: Point3D,
 543        rotation_matrix: np.ndarray,
 544        axis_a: str | Literal["X", "Y", "Z"],
 545        axis_b: str | Literal["X", "Y", "Z"],
 546    ):
 547
 548        # get the relevant axis map
 549        cols = point.columns
 550        plane_axes = np.array([axis_a, axis_b])
 551        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in plane_axes]
 552        col_map = np.array(col_map)
 553
 554        # get the point used to calculate the angle
 555        centered = (point - origin).to_numpy()
 556        rotated = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rotation_matrix, centered)
 557        x, y = rotated[:, col_map].T
 558
 559        # get the angle
 560        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
 561
 562        # convert to signal
 563        angle = Signal1D(angle, point.index, "")
 564
 565        return angle, np.asarray(x, float), np.asarray(y, float)
 566
 567    def _get_projected_pelvis_points(self):
 568        # get the pelvis references
 569        l_asis = self._get_point("left_asis")
 570        r_asis = self._get_point("right_asis")
 571        l_psis = self._get_point("left_psis")
 572        r_psis = self._get_point("right_psis")
 573
 574        # generate the pelvis plane by least squares
 575        plane = self._get_least_squares_plane_coefs(l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis)
 576        plane = Timeseries(
 577            data=plane,
 578            index=l_asis.index,
 579            columns=["a", "b", "c", "d"],
 580            unit="a.u.",
 581        )
 582
 583        # get the projected points
 584        l_asis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(l_asis, plane)
 585        r_asis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(r_asis, plane)
 586        l_psis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(l_psis, plane)
 587        r_psis_proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(r_psis, plane)
 588
 589        return l_asis_proj, r_asis_proj, l_psis_proj, r_psis_proj
 590
 591    @property
 592    def left_ankle_referenceframe(self):
 593        """
 594        return the left ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 595
 596        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 597            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 598
 599        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 600        the reference frame.
 601        """
 602        ankle_lat: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
 603        ankle_med: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
 604        ankle = self.left_ankle
 605        knee = self.left_knee
 606
 607        # get the rotation matrix
 608        new_x = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
 609        new_y = (knee - ankle).to_numpy()
 610        rmat = gram_schmidt(new_x, new_y).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 611        rmat = np.asarray(rmat, float)
 612
 613        return ankle, rmat
 614
 615    @property
 616    def right_ankle_referenceframe(self):
 617        """
 618        return the right ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 619
 620        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 621            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 622
 623        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 624        the reference frame.
 625        """
 626        ankle_lat: Point3D = self._get_point("right_ankle_lateral")
 627        ankle_med: Point3D = self._get_point("right_ankle_medial")
 628        ankle = self.right_ankle
 629        knee = self.right_knee
 630
 631        # get the rotation matrix
 632        new_x = (ankle_med - ankle_lat).to_numpy()
 633        new_y = (knee - ankle).to_numpy()
 634        rmat = gram_schmidt(new_x, new_y).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 635        rmat = np.asarray(rmat, float)
 636
 637        return ankle, rmat
 638
 639    @property

 646
 647        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 648        the reference frame.
 649        """
 650        return self.left_hip, self.pelvis_referenceframe[1]

 652    @property
 653    def right_hip_referenceframe(self):
 654        """
 655        return the right hip reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 656
 657        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 658            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 659
 660        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 661        the reference frame.
 662        """

 664
 665    @property
 666    def pelvis_referenceframe(self):
 667        """
 668        return the pelvis reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 669
 670        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 671            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 672
 673        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 674        the reference frame.
 675        """
 676
 677        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
 678        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 679
 680        # get the plane versors
 681        centroid = (l_asis + r_asis + l_psis + r_psis) / 4
 682        i = np.asarray((l_asis + l_psis) / 2 - centroid, float)
 683        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 684        k = np.asarray((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - centroid, float)
 685        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
 686        j = np.cross(k, i)
 687
 688        # obtain the rotation matrix
 689        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 690
 691        return centroid, rmat
 692
 693    @property
 694    def left_shoulder_referenceframe(self):
 695        """
 696        Return the left shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 697
 698        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 699            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 700
 701        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 702        the reference frame.
 703        """
 704        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 705        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
 706        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
 707        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
 708        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
 709
 710        # determino l'asse verticale
 711        j = c7 - base
 712
 713        # calcolo le coordinate della proiezione della spalla sull'asse
 714        # verticale passante per il centro della pelvi
 715        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 716            point=shoulder,
 717            origin=pelvis_center,
 718            direction=j,
 719        )
 720
 721        # calcolo l'asse laterale
 722        i = shoulder - proj
 723
 724        # ottengo la matrice di rotazione
 725        rmat = gram_schmidt(i.to_numpy(), j.to_numpy()).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 726
 727        return shoulder, rmat
 728
 729    @property
 730    def right_shoulder_referenceframe(self):
 731        """
 732        Return the right shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
 733
 734        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
 735            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
 736
 737        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
 738        the reference frame.
 739        """
 740        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
 741        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
 742        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
 743        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
 744        shoulder = self.right_shoulder
 745
 746        # determino l'asse verticale
 747        j = c7 - base
 748
 749        # calcolo le coordinate della proiezione della spalla sull'asse
 750        # verticale passante per il centro della pelvi
 751        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
 752            point=shoulder,
 753            origin=pelvis_center,
 754            direction=j,
 755        )
 756
 757        # calcolo l'asse laterale
 758        i = proj - shoulder
 759
 760        # ottengo la matrice di rotazione
 761        rmat = gram_schmidt(i.to_numpy(), j.to_numpy()).transpose((0, 2, 1))
 762
 763        return shoulder, rmat

 765    @property
 766    def left_ankle(self):
 767        lat: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
 768        med: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
 769        return Point3D(
 770            data=(lat._data + med._data) / 2,
 771            index=np.unique(np.concatenate([lat.index, med.index])),
 772            columns=lat.columns,
 773        )

 805    @property
 806    def pelvis_center(self):
 807        return self.pelvis_referenceframe[0]
 808
 809    @property
 810    def pelvis_plane(self):
 811
 812        # extract the normal as the vertical axis denoted by the rotation
 813        # matrix of the pelvis reference frame
 814        centroid, rmat = self.pelvis_referenceframe
 815        normal = rmat[:, 1, :]
 816
 817        # get the "d" coefficient
 818        d = np.atleast_2d(-np.sum(normal * centroid.to_numpy(), axis=1)).T
 819
 820        # return the timeseries
 821        return Timeseries(
 822            data=np.hstack([normal, d]),
 823            index=centroid.index,
 824            columns=["a", "b", "c", "d"],
 825            unit="a.u.",
 826        )
 827
 828    @property
 829    def pelvis_width(self):
 830        l_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("left_asis")
 831        r_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("right_asis")
 832        index = [l_asis.index, r_asis.index]
 833        index = np.unique(np.concatenate(index)).tolist()
 834        data = np.asarray(l_asis - r_asis)
 835        data = np.sum(data**2, axis=1) ** 0.5
 836        return Signal1D(data=data, index=index, unit=l_asis.unit)
 837
 838    @property
 839    def pelvis_height(self):
 840        pelvis_plane = self.pelvis_plane
 841        l_troc = self._get_point("left_throcanter")
 842        r_troc = self._get_point("right_throcanter")
 843        l_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(l_troc, pelvis_plane)
 844        r_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(r_troc, pelvis_plane)
 845        return Signal1D(
 846            data=(l_dist + r_dist).to_numpy() / 2,
 847            index=pelvis_plane.index,
 848            unit=l_dist.unit,
 849        )
 850
 851    @property
 852    def left_hip(self):
 853
 854        # get the De Leva (1996) approximations
 855        p0 = self.pelvis_center
 856        width = self.pelvis_width.to_numpy()
 857        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
 858        offset_ml = -0.19 * width
 859        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
 860        offset_ap = 0.36 * width
 861        offsets = Signal3D(
 862            data=np.hstack([offset_ml, offset_vt, offset_ap]),
 863            index=p0.index,
 864            columns=p0.columns,
 865            unit=p0.unit,
 866        )
 867        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
 868            self._get_point("left_throcanter"),
 869            offsets,
 870            self.pelvis_plane,
 871        )
 872
 873    @property

 879        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
 880        offset_ml = +0.19 * width
 881        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
 882        offset_ap = +0.36 * width
 883        offsets = Signal3D(

 885            index=p0.index,
 886            columns=p0.columns,
 887            unit=p0.unit,
 888        )
 889        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
 890            self._get_point("right_throcanter"),
 891            offsets,
 892            self.pelvis_plane,
 893        )

 979    @property
 980    def left_ankle_flexionextension(self):
 981        """
 982        the the dorsal (positive) or plantar (negative) flexion of the
 983        left ankle with respect to he shin in degrees
 984        """
 985        # get points and reference frame
 986        ankle, rmat = self.left_ankle_referenceframe
 987        proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(
 988            ankle,
 989            self.left_foot_plane,
 990        )
 991        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
 992            proj,
 993            ankle,
 994            rmat,
 995            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
 996            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
 997        )
 998
 999        # adjust the signs
1000        return angle + 90
1001

1065    @property
1066    def left_knee_flexionextension(self):
1067        """
1068        return the left knee flexion in degrees.
1069        Extension will be negative
1070        """
1071        p1 = self.left_hip
1072        p2 = self.left_knee
1073        p3 = self.left_ankle
1074        angle = 180 - self._get_angle_between_three_points(p1, p2, p3)
1075        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=p1.index, unit="")

1161    @property
1162    def left_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1163        """
1164        Return the left hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1165        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1166        """
1167
1168        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1169        rmat = self.left_hip_referenceframe[1]
1170        knee_lat = self._get_point("left_knee_lateral")
1171        knee_med = self._get_point("left_knee_medial")
1172        ankle_lat = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
1173        ankle_med = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
1174
1175        # ottengo il vettore medio
1176        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1177        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1178        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1179
1180        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1181        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1182        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1183        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1184        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1185        j = np.cross(k, i)
1186        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1187
1188        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1189        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1190
1191        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1192        # generato
1193        cols = knee_lat.columns
1194        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1195        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1196        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1197        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1198
1199        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1200        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1201
1202        # Ritorno l'angolo
1203        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")
1204
1205    @property
1206    def right_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1207        """
1208        Return the right hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1209        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1210        """
1211        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1212        rmat = self.right_hip_referenceframe[1]
1213        knee_lat = self._get_point("right_knee_lateral")
1214        knee_med = self._get_point("right_knee_medial")
1215        ankle_lat = self._get_point("right_ankle_lateral")
1216        ankle_med = self._get_point("right_ankle_medial")
1217
1218        # ottengo il vettore medio
1219        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1220        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1221        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1222
1223        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1224        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1225        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1226        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1227        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1228        j = np.cross(k, i)
1229        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1230
1231        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1232        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1233
1234        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1235        # generato
1236        cols = knee_lat.columns
1237        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1238        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1239        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1240        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1241
1242        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1243        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1244
1245        # correggo il segno dell'angolo
1246        angle = 180 - angle
1247        angle[y < 0] = angle[y < 0] - 360
1248
1249        # Ritorno l'angolo
1250        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")
1251
1252    @property
1253    def pelvis_anteroposteriortilt_global(self):
1254        """
1255        Return the pelvis pitch (sagittal tilt) in degrees with respect to
1256        the global reference frame.
1257        Anterior tilt is negative, posterior tilt is positive.
1258        """
1259
1260        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
1261        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1262
1263        # definisco il vettore che determina l'asse anteroposteriore del bacino
1264        ap = ((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - (l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1265
1266        # considero solo il piano sagittale globale
1267        cols = l_asis.columns
1268        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1269        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1270        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1271
1272        # calcolo l'angolo
1273        x, y = ap[:, col_map].T
1274        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1275
1276        # Ritorno langolo
1277        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=l_asis.index, unit="")

1335        """

1343

1346        base = ((l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1347        vt = c7 - base
1348

1350        cols = l_psis.columns
1351        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]

1357        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1358

1360        return Signal1D(data=90 - angle, index=l_psis.index, unit="")

1457    @property
1458    def left_shoulder_flexionextension(self):
1459        """
1460        Return the left shoulder flexion/extension in degrees with respect
1461        to the neck base.
1462        Positive values denote flexion, while negative values indicate
1463        extension.
1464        """
1465        # ottengo i parametri necessari
1466        shoulder, rmat = self.left_shoulder_referenceframe
1467        elbow = self.left_elbow
1468
1469        # calcolo l'orientamento del braccio rispetto al sistema di riferimento
1470        # della spalla
1471        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
1472            elbow,
1473            shoulder,
1474            rmat,
1475            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
1476            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
1477        )
1478
1479        return 90 + angle

1551    @property
1552    def left_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1553        """
1554        Return the left shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1555        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1556        """
1557        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1558        elbow_lat = self._get_point("left_elbow_lateral")
1559        elbow_med = self._get_point("left_elbow_medial")
1560        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1561        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
1562        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
1563        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
1564        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
1565        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
1566            shoulder,
1567            pelvis_center,
1568            c7 - base,
1569        )
1570
1571        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1572        va = (elbow_lat - elbow_med).to_numpy()
1573
1574        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1575        i = (shoulder - proj).to_numpy()
1576        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1577        k = (shoulder - self.left_elbow).to_numpy()
1578        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1579        j = np.cross(k, i)
1580        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1581
1582        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1583        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1584
1585        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1586        # generato
1587        cols = elbow_lat.columns
1588        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1589        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1590        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1591        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1592
1593        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1594        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1595
1596        # Ritorno l'angolo
1597        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")
1598
1599    @property
1600    def right_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1601        """
1602        Return the right shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1603        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1604        """
1605        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1606        elbow_lat = self._get_point("right_elbow_lateral")
1607        elbow_med = self._get_point("right_elbow_medial")
1608        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1609        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2

1614            shoulder,
1615            pelvis_center,
1616            c7 - base,
1617        )
1618
1619        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1620        va = (elbow_med - elbow_lat).to_numpy()
1621
1622        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1623        i = (proj - shoulder).to_numpy()
1624        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1625        k = (shoulder - self.right_elbow).to_numpy()
1626        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1627        j = np.cross(k, i)
1628        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1629
1630        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1631        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1632
1633        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1634        # generato

1636        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]

1640

1642        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))

1645        return Signal1D(data=-angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")
