A dictionary-like container for Timeseries, TimeseriesRecord, and ForcePlatform objects, supporting type filtering and DataFrame conversion.

Parameters
  • vertical_axis (str, optional): The label for the vertical axis (default "Y").
  • anteroposterior_axis (str, optional): The label for the anteroposterior axis (default "Z").
  • strip (bool, optional): If True, remove leading/trailing rows or columns that are all NaN from all contained objects (default True).
  • reset_time (bool, optional): If True, reset the time index to start at zero for all contained objects (default True).
  • **signals (dict): Key-value pairs of Timeseries subclasses, TimeseriesRecord, or ForcePlatform to include in the record.
Attributes
  • _vertical_axis (str): The vertical axis label.
  • _antpos_axis (str): The anteroposterior axis label.
Methods

copy() Return a deep copy of the TimeseriesRecord. strip(axis=0, inplace=False) Remove leading/trailing rows or columns that are all NaN from all contained objects. reset_time(inplace=False) Reset the time index to start at zero for all contained objects. apply(func, axis=0, inplace=False, *args, **kwargs) Apply a function or ProcessingPipeline to all contained objects. fillna(value=None, n_regressors=None, inplace=False) Fill NaNs for all contained objects. to_dataframe() Convert the record to a pandas DataFrame with MultiIndex columns. from_tdf(filename) Create a TimeseriesRecord from a TDF file.

184        right_elbow_medial: str | None = None,
185        right_elbow_lateral: str | None = None,

187        left_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
188        right_wrist_medial: str | None = None,
189        right_wrist_lateral: str | None = None,
190        s2: str | None = None,
191        l2: str | None = None,
192        c7: str | None = None,
193        sc: str | None = None,
194    ):
195
196        # generate the new object
197        obj = cls()
198
199        # read the file
200        tdf = TimeseriesRecord.from_tdf(filename)
201
202        # check the inputs
203        inputs = {
204            "ground_reaction_force": ground_reaction_force,
205            "left_hand_ground_reaction_force": left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
206            "right_hand_ground_reaction_force": right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
207            "left_foot_ground_reaction_force": left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
208            "right_foot_ground_reaction_force": right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
209            "left_heel": left_heel,
210            "right_heel": right_heel,
211            "left_toe": left_toe,
212            "right_toe": right_toe,
213            "left_metatarsal_head": left_metatarsal_head,
214            "right_metatarsal_head": right_metatarsal_head,
215            "left_ankle_medial": left_ankle_medial,
216            "left_ankle_lateral": left_ankle_lateral,
217            "right_ankle_medial": right_ankle_medial,
218            "right_ankle_lateral": right_ankle_lateral,
219            "left_knee_medial": left_knee_medial,
220            "left_knee_lateral": left_knee_lateral,
221            "right_knee_medial": right_knee_medial,
222            "right_knee_lateral": right_knee_lateral,
223            "right_throcanter": right_throcanter,
224            "left_throcanter": left_throcanter,
225            "left_asis": left_asis,
226            "right_asis": right_asis,
227            "left_psis": left_psis,
228            "right_psis": right_psis,
229            "left_shoulder_anterior": left_shoulder_anterior,
230            "left_shoulder_posterior": left_shoulder_posterior,
231            "right_shoulder_anterior": right_shoulder_anterior,
232            "right_shoulder_posterior": right_shoulder_posterior,
233            "left_elbow_medial": left_elbow_medial,
234            "left_elbow_lateral": left_elbow_lateral,
235            "right_elbow_medial": right_elbow_medial,
236            "right_elbow_lateral": right_elbow_lateral,
237            "left_wrist_medial": left_wrist_medial,
238            "left_wrist_lateral": left_wrist_lateral,
239            "right_wrist_medial": right_wrist_medial,
240            "right_wrist_lateral": right_wrist_lateral,
241            "s2": s2,
242            "c7": c7,
243            "l2": l2,
244            "sc": sc,
245        }
246        inputs = {i: v for i, v in inputs.items() if v is not None}
247        keys = tdf.keys()
248        for lbl, inp in inputs.items():
249            if inp not in keys:
250                raise ValueError(f"{inp} not found.")
251            val = tdf[inp]
252            if inp in [
253                left_foot_ground_reaction_force,
254                right_foot_ground_reaction_force,
255                ground_reaction_force,
256                left_hand_ground_reaction_force,
257                right_hand_ground_reaction_force,
258            ]:
259                if not isinstance(val, ForcePlatform):
260                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a ForcePlatform instance."
261                    raise ValueError(msg)
262            else:
263                if not isinstance(val, Point3D):
264                    msg = f"{inp} has to be a Point3D instance."
265                    raise ValueError(msg)
266            obj[lbl] = val
267        for key, val in tdf.items():
268            if key not in list(inputs.values()):
269                obj[key] = val
270
271        return obj

def to_dataframe(self): 
273    def to_dataframe(self):
274        out = [super().to_dataframe()]
275        for prop in self._angular_measures:
276            try:
277                df = getattr(self, prop).to_dataframe()
278                df.columns = pd.Index([prop + "_" + i] for i in df.columns)
279                out += [df]
280            except Exception as exc:
281                continue
282
283        return pd.concat(out, axis=1)

left_ankle_referenceframe 
591    @property
592    def left_ankle_referenceframe(self):
593        """
594        return the left ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
595
596        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
597            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
598
599        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
600        the reference frame.
601        """
602        ankle_lat: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
603        ankle_med: Point3D = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
604        ankle = self.left_ankle
605        knee = self.left_knee
606
607        # get the rotation matrix
608        new_x = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
609        new_y = (knee - ankle).to_numpy()
610        rmat = gram_schmidt(new_x, new_y).transpose((0, 2, 1))
611        rmat = np.asarray(rmat, float)
612
613        return ankle, rmat

return the left ankle reference frame origin and rotation matrix.

pelvis_referenceframe 
665    @property
666    def pelvis_referenceframe(self):
667        """
668        return the pelvis reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
669
670        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
671            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
672
673        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
674        the reference frame.
675        """
676
677        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
678        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
679
680        # get the plane versors
681        centroid = (l_asis + r_asis + l_psis + r_psis) / 4
682        i = np.asarray((l_asis + l_psis) / 2 - centroid, float)
683        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
684        k = np.asarray((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - centroid, float)
685        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
686        j = np.cross(k, i)
687
688        # obtain the rotation matrix
689        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
690
691        return centroid, rmat

return the pelvis reference frame origin and rotation matrix.

A point can be aligned to this reference frame by: new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)

Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of the reference frame.

left_shoulder_referenceframe 
693    @property
694    def left_shoulder_referenceframe(self):
695        """
696        Return the left shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.
697
698        A point can be aligned to this reference frame by:
699            new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)
700
701        Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of
702        the reference frame.
703        """
704        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
705        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
706        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
707        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
708        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
709
710        # determino l'asse verticale
711        j = c7 - base
712
713        # calcolo le coordinate della proiezione della spalla sull'asse
714        # verticale passante per il centro della pelvi
715        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
716            point=shoulder,
717            origin=pelvis_center,
718            direction=j,
719        )
720
721        # calcolo l'asse laterale
722        i = shoulder - proj
723
724        # ottengo la matrice di rotazione
725        rmat = gram_schmidt(i.to_numpy(), j.to_numpy()).transpose((0, 2, 1))
726
727        return shoulder, rmat

Return the left shoulder reference frame origin and rotation matrix.

A point can be aligned to this reference frame by: new = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", R, old - O)

Where R is the rotation matrix (N, 3, 3) and O (N, 3) is the origin of the reference frame.

805    @property

pelvis_plane 
809    @property
810    def pelvis_plane(self):
811
812        # extract the normal as the vertical axis denoted by the rotation
813        # matrix of the pelvis reference frame
814        centroid, rmat = self.pelvis_referenceframe
815        normal = rmat[:, 1, :]
816
817        # get the "d" coefficient
818        d = np.atleast_2d(-np.sum(normal * centroid.to_numpy(), axis=1)).T
819
820        # return the timeseries
821        return Timeseries(
822            data=np.hstack([normal, d]),
823            index=centroid.index,
824            columns=["a", "b", "c", "d"],
825            unit="a.u.",
826        )
pelvis_width 
828    @property
829    def pelvis_width(self):
830        l_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("left_asis")
831        r_asis: Point3D = self._get_point("right_asis")
832        index = [l_asis.index, r_asis.index]
833        index = np.unique(np.concatenate(index)).tolist()
834        data = np.asarray(l_asis - r_asis)
835        data = np.sum(data**2, axis=1) ** 0.5
836        return Signal1D(data=data, index=index, unit=l_asis.unit)
pelvis_height 
838    @property
839    def pelvis_height(self):
840        pelvis_plane = self.pelvis_plane
841        l_troc = self._get_point("left_throcanter")
842        r_troc = self._get_point("right_throcanter")
843        l_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(l_troc, pelvis_plane)
844        r_dist = self._get_point_to_plane_distance(r_troc, pelvis_plane)
845        return Signal1D(
846            data=(l_dist + r_dist).to_numpy() / 2,
847            index=pelvis_plane.index,
848            unit=l_dist.unit,
849        )
left_hip 
851    @property
852    def left_hip(self):
853
854        # get the De Leva (1996) approximations
855        p0 = self.pelvis_center
856        width = self.pelvis_width.to_numpy()
857        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
858        offset_ml = -0.19 * width
859        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
860        offset_ap = 0.36 * width
861        offsets = Signal3D(
862            data=np.hstack([offset_ml, offset_vt, offset_ap]),
863            index=p0.index,
864            columns=p0.columns,
865            unit=p0.unit,
866        )
867        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
868            self._get_point("left_throcanter"),
869            offsets,
870            self.pelvis_plane,
871        )
right_hip 
873    @property
874    def right_hip(self):
875
876        # get the De Leva (1996) approximations
877        p0 = self.pelvis_center
878        width = self.pelvis_width.to_numpy()
879        height = self.pelvis_height.to_numpy()
880        offset_ml = +0.19 * width
881        offset_vt = -0.14 * height
882        offset_ap = +0.36 * width
883        offsets = Signal3D(
884            data=np.hstack([offset_ml, offset_vt, offset_ap]),
885            index=p0.index,
886            columns=p0.columns,
887            unit=p0.unit,
888        )
889        return self._get_translated_point_along_plane(
890            self._get_point("right_throcanter"),
891            offsets,
892            self.pelvis_plane,
893        )

left_ankle_flexionextension 
 979    @property
 980    def left_ankle_flexionextension(self):
 981        """
 982        the the dorsal (positive) or plantar (negative) flexion of the
 983        left ankle with respect to he shin in degrees
 984        """
 985        # get points and reference frame
 986        ankle, rmat = self.left_ankle_referenceframe
 987        proj = self._get_projection_point_on_plane(
 988            ankle,
 989            self.left_foot_plane,
 990        )
 991        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
 992            proj,
 993            ankle,
 994            rmat,
 995            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
 996            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
 997        )
 998
 999        # adjust the signs
1000        return angle + 90

the the dorsal (positive) or plantar (negative) flexion of the left ankle with respect to he shin in degrees

left_knee_flexionextension 
1065    @property
1066    def left_knee_flexionextension(self):
1067        """
1068        return the left knee flexion in degrees.
1069        Extension will be negative
1070        """
1071        p1 = self.left_hip
1072        p2 = self.left_knee
1073        p3 = self.left_ankle
1074        angle = 180 - self._get_angle_between_three_points(p1, p2, p3)
1075        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=p1.index, unit="")

return the left knee flexion in degrees. Extension will be negative

left_hip_internalexternalrotation 
1161    @property
1162    def left_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1163        """
1164        Return the left hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1165        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1166        """
1167
1168        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1169        rmat = self.left_hip_referenceframe[1]
1170        knee_lat = self._get_point("left_knee_lateral")
1171        knee_med = self._get_point("left_knee_medial")
1172        ankle_lat = self._get_point("left_ankle_lateral")
1173        ankle_med = self._get_point("left_ankle_medial")
1174
1175        # ottengo il vettore medio
1176        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1177        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1178        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1179
1180        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1181        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1182        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1183        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1184        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1185        j = np.cross(k, i)
1186        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1187
1188        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1189        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1190
1191        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1192        # generato
1193        cols = knee_lat.columns
1194        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1195        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1196        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1197        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1198
1199        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1200        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1201
1202        # Ritorno l'angolo
1203        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")

Return the left hip internal/external rotation in degrees. Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.

right_hip_internalexternalrotation 
1205    @property
1206    def right_hip_internalexternalrotation(self):
1207        """
1208        Return the right hip internal/external rotation in degrees.
1209        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1210        """
1211        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1212        rmat = self.right_hip_referenceframe[1]
1213        knee_lat = self._get_point("right_knee_lateral")
1214        knee_med = self._get_point("right_knee_medial")
1215        ankle_lat = self._get_point("right_ankle_lateral")
1216        ankle_med = self._get_point("right_ankle_medial")
1217
1218        # ottengo il vettore medio
1219        v1 = (knee_lat - knee_med).to_numpy()
1220        v2 = (ankle_lat - ankle_med).to_numpy()
1221        va = (v1 + v2) / 2
1222
1223        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1224        i = (self.left_hip - self.right_hip).to_numpy()
1225        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1226        k = (self.left_hip - self.left_knee).to_numpy()
1227        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1228        j = np.cross(k, i)
1229        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1230
1231        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1232        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1233
1234        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1235        # generato
1236        cols = knee_lat.columns
1237        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1238        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1239        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1240        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1241
1242        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1243        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1244
1245        # correggo il segno dell'angolo
1246        angle = 180 - angle
1247        angle[y < 0] = angle[y < 0] - 360
1248
1249        # Ritorno l'angolo
1250        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=knee_lat.index, unit="")

Return the right hip internal/external rotation in degrees. Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.

pelvis_anteroposteriortilt_global 
1252    @property
1253    def pelvis_anteroposteriortilt_global(self):
1254        """
1255        Return the pelvis pitch (sagittal tilt) in degrees with respect to
1256        the global reference frame.
1257        Anterior tilt is negative, posterior tilt is positive.
1258        """
1259
1260        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
1261        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1262
1263        # definisco il vettore che determina l'asse anteroposteriore del bacino
1264        ap = ((l_asis + r_asis) / 2 - (l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1265
1266        # considero solo il piano sagittale globale
1267        cols = l_asis.columns
1268        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1269        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1270        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1271
1272        # calcolo l'angolo
1273        x, y = ap[:, col_map].T
1274        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1275
1276        # Ritorno langolo
1277        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=l_asis.index, unit="")

Return the pelvis pitch (sagittal tilt) in degrees with respect to the global reference frame. Anterior tilt is negative, posterior tilt is positive.

trunk_flexionextension_global 
1333    @property
1334    def trunk_flexionextension_global(self):
1335        """
1336        Return the trunk flexion/extension in degrees with respect
1337        to the global reference frame.
1338        Flexion is positive, extension is negative.
1339        """
1340
1341        # get the pelvis points projected into its least squares plane
1342        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1343
1344        # ottengo il vettore che definisce il rachide
1345        c7 = self._get_point("c7").to_numpy()
1346        base = ((l_psis + r_psis) / 2).to_numpy()
1347        vt = c7 - base
1348
1349        # considero solo il piano sagittale globale
1350        cols = l_psis.columns
1351        axes_labels = [self.anteroposterior_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1352        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1353        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1354
1355        # calcolo l'angolo
1356        x, y = vt[:, col_map].T
1357        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1358
1359        # Ritorno langolo
1360        return Signal1D(data=90 - angle, index=l_psis.index, unit="")

Return the trunk flexion/extension in degrees with respect to the global reference frame. Flexion is positive, extension is negative.

1378        # considero solo il piano frontale globale
1379        cols = l_psis.columns
1380        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.vertical_axis]
1381        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1382        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1383
1384        # calcolo l'angolo
1385        x, y = vt[:, col_map].T
1386        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1387
1388        # Ritorno langolo
1389        return Signal1D(data=angle - 90, index=l_psis.index, unit="")

Return the trunk lateral tilt (side bending) in degrees with respect to the global reference frame. Right tilt is negative, left tilt is positive.

trunk_rotation_global 
1391    @property
1392    def trunk_rotation_global(self):
1393        """
1394        Return the trunk axial rotation in degrees with respect to the
1395        global reference frame.
1396        Right rotation is positive, left rotation is negative.
1397        """
1398
1399        # ottengo il vettore che definisce l'asse delle spalle
1400        vt = self.left_shoulder - self.right_shoulder
1401
1402        # considero solo il piano trasverso globale
1403        cols = vt.columns
1404        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1405        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1406        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1407
1408        # calcolo l'angolo
1409        x, y = vt.copy().to_numpy()[:, col_map].T
1410        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1411
1412        # Ritorno langolo
1413        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=vt.index, unit="")

Return the trunk axial rotation in degrees with respect to the global reference frame. Right rotation is positive, left rotation is negative.

left_shoulder_flexionextension 
1457    @property
1458    def left_shoulder_flexionextension(self):
1459        """
1460        Return the left shoulder flexion/extension in degrees with respect
1461        to the neck base.
1462        Positive values denote flexion, while negative values indicate
1463        extension.
1464        """
1465        # ottengo i parametri necessari
1466        shoulder, rmat = self.left_shoulder_referenceframe
1467        elbow = self.left_elbow
1468
1469        # calcolo l'orientamento del braccio rispetto al sistema di riferimento
1470        # della spalla
1471        angle, x, y = self._get_angle_by_point_on_reference_frame_and_plane(
1472            elbow,
1473            shoulder,
1474            rmat,
1475            self.anteroposterior_axis,  # type: ignore
1476            self.vertical_axis,  # type: ignore
1477        )
1478
1479        return 90 + angle

Return the left shoulder flexion/extension in degrees with respect to the neck base. Positive values denote flexion, while negative values indicate extension.

left_shoulder_internalexternalrotation 
1551    @property
1552    def left_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1553        """
1554        Return the left shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1555        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1556        """
1557        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1558        elbow_lat = self._get_point("left_elbow_lateral")
1559        elbow_med = self._get_point("left_elbow_medial")
1560        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1561        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
1562        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
1563        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
1564        shoulder = self.left_shoulder
1565        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
1566            shoulder,
1567            pelvis_center,
1568            c7 - base,
1569        )
1570
1571        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1572        va = (elbow_lat - elbow_med).to_numpy()
1573
1574        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1575        i = (shoulder - proj).to_numpy()
1576        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1577        k = (shoulder - self.left_elbow).to_numpy()
1578        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1579        j = np.cross(k, i)
1580        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1581
1582        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1583        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1584
1585        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1586        # generato
1587        cols = elbow_lat.columns
1588        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1589        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1590        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1591        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1592
1593        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1594        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1595
1596        # Ritorno l'angolo
1597        return Signal1D(data=angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")

Return the left shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees. Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.

right_shoulder_internalexternalrotation 
1599    @property
1600    def right_shoulder_internalexternalrotation(self):
1601        """
1602        Return the right shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees.
1603        Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
1604        """
1605        # Ottengo i parametri necessari
1606        elbow_lat = self._get_point("right_elbow_lateral")
1607        elbow_med = self._get_point("right_elbow_medial")
1608        l_asis, r_asis, l_psis, r_psis = self._get_projected_pelvis_points()
1609        base = (r_psis + l_psis) / 2
1610        c7 = self._get_point("c7")
1611        pelvis_center = self.pelvis_center
1612        shoulder = self.right_shoulder
1613        proj = self._get_projection_point_onto_axis(
1614            shoulder,
1615            pelvis_center,
1616            c7 - base,
1617        )
1618
1619        # ottengo il vettore di riferimento
1620        va = (elbow_med - elbow_lat).to_numpy()
1621
1622        # determio la matrice di rotazione del sistema di riferimento
1623        i = (proj - shoulder).to_numpy()
1624        i = i / np.linalg.norm(i, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1625        k = (shoulder - self.right_elbow).to_numpy()
1626        k = k / np.linalg.norm(k, axis=1, keepdims=True)
1627        j = np.cross(k, i)
1628        rmat = gram_schmidt(i, j, k).transpose((0, 2, 1))
1629
1630        # allineo il vettore al nuovo sistema di riferimento
1631        vr = np.einsum("nij,nj->ni", rmat, va)
1632
1633        # considero il piano trasverso solidale al sistema di riferimento
1634        # generato
1635        cols = elbow_lat.columns
1636        axes_labels = [self.lateral_axis, self.anteroposterior_axis]
1637        col_map = [np.where(cols == i)[0][0] for i in axes_labels]
1638        col_map = np.array(col_map)
1639        x, y = vr[:, col_map].T
1640
1641        # calcolo l'angolo del vettore rispetto al piano
1642        angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(y, x))
1643
1644        # Ritorno l'angolo
1645        return Signal1D(data=-angle, index=elbow_lat.index, unit="")

Return the right shoulder internal/external rotation in degrees. Internal rotation is positive, external rotation is negative.
